title: [BUG] Blazor Wasm [DebugMode]: No canvas element was provided
body:
### Description When I test my blazor app in debug mode from the ide, the skia content could not work. It shows "No canvas element was provided" in the browser console. When I use dotnet watch command to run my app, it works all fine. Skiasharp 3.119 ### Code I just use this simple page to test. ```razor
@code { private void OnPaintSurface(SKPaintSurfaceEventArgs args) { // My own paint commands GraphPainter.DrawOnCanvas(args.Surface.Canvas); } } ``` ### Expected Behavior _No response_ ### Actual Behavior _No response_ ### Version of SkiaSharp 3.116.0 (Current) ### Last Known Good Version of SkiaSharp 3.116.0 (Current) ### IDE / Editor Other (Please indicate in the description) ### Platform / Operating System macOS ### Platform / Operating System Version _No response_ ### Devices _No response_ ### Relevant Screenshots _No response_ ### Relevant Log Output ```shell ``` ### Code of Conduct - [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

comments.author: syminomega
comments.body: Well I found it may caused by the caching issue. At first I made a mistake, I used the interactiveAuto mode in blazor, but when i switched to interactiveWasm, it still doesn't work until l clear all the cache both in browser and the project folder. Then I run dotnet restore before I run it in debug mode, it works.

comments.author: mennowo
comments.body:
Seeing the same error here, using SkiaSharp 3.119.0 in combination with VS 17.14.2 and MudBlazor 8.6.0. However, the canvas still loads and functions. Just there appears the error and I have to close it each time I start the app.

Edit: after properly cleaning and rebuilding, I no longer had this issue.

comments.author: Benny-prog
comments.body:
Is there any update on this topic? I encounter the same issue, after updateing from 2.88.6 to 3.119.0.
I did the same, as @syminomega posted, which works fine. But my app is running on a server and is accessible for many people, which I can't tell all, how to clear the chache successfully.
